BL_BS_B5_553.text: Anime & MangaComic BooksFan WorksFilms — Live-ActionLiteratureLive-Action TVMusicPodcastsRadioTabletop GamesTheatreIn the musical version of The Nutcracker, the Nutcrackers are dressed in full military regalia, and the audience is told that they are there to protect the world from evil. In the original Broadway production, however, they were dressed in civilian clothes, and it was revealed that they were there to defend the city from the evil forces that were trying to take over the world. In later productions, they have been dressed in military garb, but the audience still knows that they're there for the good of the world, and not to protect it from evil, which is why they don't wear uniforms at all. In fact, in the original version of the show, the audience was told that the nutcrackers were there "to protect us from evil", but in later productions they've been dressed as if they were protecting the world against evil, and so the audience has no idea what they're up against.
